page.title: 03Looking at Flowers and Trees
page.content: We went for a walk on Tuesday June 18th.1985 to look at wild flowers and trees along a footpath near our school. We left the school in a North Westerly direction and found ourselves in a field for grazing ponies.The only} wild flowers were buttercups,thistle,dock, dead nettles,stinging nettles and some clover that the ponies hadn't eaten. There was also vetch and foxgloves.The footpath led through two hayfields where there was stitchwort,clover, germander speedwell,dog daisies and goatsbeard.We changed direction and walked over a wooden stile into Slack Lane.A stream runs along the side.Here we found lots of pink campion and white campion,hogweed,bugle,horse-tail,hedge parsley,Jack by the hedge,birdseye, forget-me-not,ladies' bedstraw and butterburr. (Continued on Page 4)
